comment: Thinking back, there were so many shows as a kid that should've been straight nightmare fuel, but ran for multiple seasons.  Anyone else feel the same?
Courage the Cowardly Dog is THE show that should've been straight nightmare fuel but wasn't
I mean... seriously, where do I begin with that one?
Several off the top of my head
King Ramses.  The curse where they had to grow SOMETHING on the farm.
Oh jeeze, the rest blur together into a haze ranging from slightly disturbing to nightmare made real.
I think there was the one where the computer became mobile...
if you want nightmare fuel watch Thing in the Apartment
it’s only a few short minutes
You ever watch the short film that lead to Lights Out?
Also, golden rule of horror: Big budget = shitty film <3
Tom was here but he left
Oh no, did we give him flashbacks?
Like he woke up and oops - bedtime again
Speaking of nightmares and sleep, looks like The Thing is about to start on Syfy
Hmmmm, no nightmares and sleep, or nightmares and no sleep.... I choose the latter <3
\o/  Residents brought a gift basket o' goodies to my gate! I guess I'm having a cheat day...
It's the somewhat crappy prequel and not the 1980's original :(
the conversation was on ghosts and creepy and you happily pop in some “residents” brought food
as long as they weren’t see through it’s safe
Well, found The Thing in the Apartment, they even made a new video a year later that's 2-for-1!
Watch now or later... tough call...
Oh geeze, checking youtube for one last time tonight, and now I'm getting all these horror shorts recommendations.  WIN.
Naw, these residents are legit. Just brought a big torso sized gift basket of cookies and baked treats.
They ARE trying to kill you
They didn't actually bring me a torso, just a basket big enough to held a toddler or so.
Eh, I have only had one cookie, gonna save the rest and role them out to the other guards working this area tonight.
Got a new phone and it seems like it's helping with my previously terrible internet connection.
Not fantastic by any means, still only 2-3 bars of 4G, but it's not cutting out or dropping quality every 2 minutes, so that's cool.
before bed video. Just watched a guy try parkour and he got a tree up his chimney
At first I thought you were being literal. Like, parkour is cool and all, but this dude straight up turned into the Grinch Midway and started kidnapping trees through chimneys.
a moment of silence for him but I sorta hope it rendered him infertile
You know it hurt when they curl into a ball of silence like a scared hedgehog
New Patreon Post: Magical Mishaps - Story 1 Page 25 https://www.patreon.com/posts/magical-mishaps-27398077
What a fun ride this story was. Now we can reread it again.
So, what's the next one going to be about?
now that's the million dollar question
there were these 2 pages from way back in 2012 that might be a clue
if that story had anything written of it
and I’m off for two days
Trace: "Why is everyone sitting on me"
Wait, you were a slave until now?
Awful joke aside, how as your day?
Hiddleston was originally trying for Thor. Thank chaos he became Loki
We needed a literal god to play Thor.  Thank Odin it was Chris Hemsworth <3
I can't stop thinking about that movie.
It's a shameless tearjerker, but oh man is it effective ;_;
Not even the idea of a bulge editor (as hilarious as it is) can prymy thoughts away.
I like the trivia - like Tom said he and Chris would go see showings of the movies together and they’d get little kids tugging on their parents like “dad...Loki and Thor are here”
In Soviet Russia, soup eat spoon.
And yes, my soup did eat my spoon.
I’d try a female Loki look. Got the eyes. Just not the costume
I find myself enjoying CinemaSins more than some movies xD
Right-o, heading on in for work.
Dunno if you're around, Tom, but I shotcha a quick email.
any of you heard of How to Catch a Cheater
